com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HIVariwide

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISeries
        • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HIVariwide
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HIVariwide
extends HISeries
    A variwide series. If the type option is not specified, it is inherited from chart.type. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels: 1. Options for all series in a chart are defined in the [plotOptions.series](plotOptions.series) object. 2. Options for all variwide series are defined in [plotOptions.variwide](plotOptions.variwide). 3. Options for one single series are given in [the series instance array](series.variwide). Highcharts.chart('container', { plotOptions: { series: { // general options for all series }, variwide: { // shared options for all variwide series } }, series: [{ // specific options for this series instance type: 'variwide' }] });

      • setPointPadding

        public void setPointPadding(java.lang.Number pointPadding)
        description: In a variwide chart, the point padding is 0 in order to express the horizontal stacking of items. demo:  •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-pointpadding-default/ : 0.1 by default •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-pointpadding-025/ : 0.25 •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-pointpadding-none/ : 0 for tightly packed columns

      • getPointPadding

      • setGroupPadding

        public void setGroupPadding(java.lang.Number groupPadding)
        description: In a variwide chart, the group padding is 0 in order to express the horizontal stacking of items. demo:  •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-grouppadding-default/ : 0.2 by default •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-grouppadding-none/ : No group padding - all columns are evenly spaced

        Try it:

         •  Rounded columns

        default:

         0

      • getBorderRadius

        public java.lang.Number getBorderRadius()

      • setPointRange

        public void setPointRange(java.lang.Number pointRange)
        The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points. The default null means it is computed automatically, but this option can be used to override the automatic value.

        Try it:

         •  Set the point range to one day on a data set with one week between the points

      • getPointRange

        public java.lang.Number getPointRange()

      • setMinPointLength

        public void setMinPointLength(java.lang.Number minPointLength)
        The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3\. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

        Try it:

         •  Zero base value
         •  Positive and negative close to zero values

      • getMinPointLength

        public java.lang.Number getMinPointLength()

      • setBorderColor

        public void setBorderColor(HIColor borderColor)
        The color of the border surrounding each column or bar. In styled mode, the border stroke can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

        Try it:

         •  Dark gray border

        default:

         #ffffff

      • setColorByPoint

        public void setColorByPoint(java.lang.Boolean colorByPoint)
        When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

        Try it:

         •  False by default
         •  True

        default:

         false

      • getColorByPoint

      • setMaxPointWidth

        public void setMaxPointWidth(java.lang.Number maxPointWidth)
        The maximum allowed pixel width for a column, translated to the height of a bar in a bar chart. This prevents the columns from becoming too wide when there is a small number of points in the chart.

        Try it:

         •  Limited to 50

        default:

         null

      • getMaxPointWidth

        public java.lang.Number getMaxPointWidth()

      • setPointWidth

        public void setPointWidth(java.lang.Number pointWidth)
        A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

        Try it:

         •  20px wide columns regardless of chart width or the amount of data points

        default:

         null

      • getPointWidth

        public java.lang.Number getPointWidth()

      • setBorderWidth

        public void setBorderWidth(java.lang.Number borderWidth)
        The width of the border surrounding each column or bar. In styled mode, the stroke width can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

        Try it:

         •  2px black border

        default:

         1

      • getBorderWidth

        public java.lang.Number getBorderWidth()

      • setGrouping

        public void setGrouping(java.lang.Boolean grouping)
        Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

        Try it:

         •  Grouping disabled

        default:

         true
